subject: Public Speaking
title: Toussaint Louverture's Call for Freedom
description: A micro-lesson that makes Toussaint Louverture's Call for Freedom usable.

hook.text: In 1791, enslaved Haitians launched the only successful slave revolution in history. Words lit the fuse.

buildup.text: Toussaint Louverture, a self-educated former slave, used speeches and proclamations to unify rebel factions.

discovery.text: He quoted the French Revolution's own ideals â€” liberty, equality, fraternity â€” against the French colonizers.

twist.text: France arrested him. From prison, he warned: You have cut down the trunk, but the roots are deep.

climax.text: Haiti became free in 1804. Toussaint's words outlived his captors and inspired abolitionists worldwide.

punchline.text: He turned the oppressor's words into weapons.

quiz.question: What rhetorical strategy did Toussaint Louverture use?
